paper_metadata.title: MAIN TEXT
paper_metadata.extraction_summary: Extracted information on KCNH2 variants, including penetrance data and individual records.

patients.phenotype: Long QT syndrome (LQT2) with sudden cardiac arrest

individual_records.phenotype_details: sudden cardiac arrest due to ventricular fibrillation
individual_records.evidence_sentence: The proband (arrow) presented a sudden cardiac arrest (SCA) due to ventricular fibrillation at 45 during an episode of hypokalemia requiring an implantable cardiac defibrillator (ICD).
Family members cascade screening detected the KCNH2 variation in her sister and two children III-1 and III-4; QTc interval values (in ms) are shown between parentheses.
Family members cascade screening detected the KCNH2 variation in her sister and two children III-1 and III-4; QTc interval values (in ms) are shown between parentheses.
ECG tracings in lead V5 of the proband (II-2), a non-carrier niece (III-7), a daughter (III-1) and a son (III-4) who are both carriers of the variant and showing mild LQT2 phenotype.

functional_data.summary: The c.2504G>C variant leads to hERG loss of function.

variants.segregation_data: The variant segregates with disease in the family.
variants.evidence_level: strong evidence based on family segregation and functional studies.
variants.additional_notes: The variant is associated with a significant risk of LQT2 and sudden cardiac events.
key_quotes: The proband (arrow) presented a sudden cardiac arrest (SCA) due to ventricular fibrillation at 45 during an episode of hypokalemia requiring an implantable cardiac defibrillator (ICD).
Family members cascade screening detected the KCNH2 variation in her sister and two children III-1 and III-4; QTc interval values (in ms) are shown between parentheses.

extraction_metadata.notes: All relevant data was extracted from the main text.
